annotation.TEXT: Whoa. I got dangerously close to those spikes a couple times there.
Whoa! Where did that guy come from? Good thing I stomped him without getting hit!
Hard demo count: 5
No. Freaking. Way.

Argh! Why did I have to have the worst luck here? And, because of the awful hit box detection involving Big Mario and Boo Rings, and the fact that one hit kills me right now, I really have no choice but to wait!
Oh, what? Come on! Let me grab that darned ice block!
So, I'll take this as distinct proof that Hard mode wasn't tested, or at least wasn't tested completely.
Uh, oh. I hope I don't run out of time in the Credits level!
There it is! ...Whoa! I wasn't expecting to take off like that!
Zwee!
Once again, I got the vine to appear successfully, and once again, only the 1-up appeared.
That's four Yoshi coins, but I think this level was lacking a fifth one.
Why did I go further to the left of the Yoshi coin here? There was only those six coins and nothing else.
Yeah, I should be able to take flight here-- Whoa, holy crap!
Oh, good. The game's letting me through these blocks right away this time. But, actually, I want to fly over the top and break the level, because... reasons.
Alright, so let's enter Spooky Walk next.
Hard demo count: 3
W-W-Whoa! Had a few slip ups there. Okay, let's back up a moment to regain my composure and let this Boo get out of my way...
Hmm... The 1-up didn't spawn, but the cape feather did. If I collect the feather, then the vine below should be able to spawn.

Well, I got all of the Yoshi coins, and I entered the boss room with 31 seconds left, which would normally be the bare minimum needed, but that's when the timer is counting down at normal speed. Since it's counting down twice as fast, I probably needed at least 61 seconds left to start the boss battle with, so... I'm doomed!
That was a close call with that Boo there.
Ah, since I'm still caped, I can thwack the Boo Rocks here, which is handy.
Just made it to the 1-up here in time!
Okay, I'm entering the boss battle with 197 on the clock, which should be way more than enough this time. So, I just have to avoid taking a dumb hit somewhere.
Come on. Where's my feather?
Hello, and welcome back to COLLAB! Ahh, it's so nice to not see corrupted overworld paths this time because I haven't played too much in any one level on this playthrough... yet.
This means I've gotta get through this entire level in one go, and also make sure that the blue koopa over here doesn't get in my way again.

And that's game! Huh. Scrolling the Big Boo Boss off the screen horizontally after he's beaten triggered the victory fanfare sooner, which saves a couple of seconds (but I still wasn't gonna win with the 31 seconds that I entered with last time-- I probably still needed to enter with the timer in the mid-to-upper 50s at least).
To be continued...
And, I think I'm going to break the level a bit now.
Push!
I could've explored further to the left up there, but I didn't want to waste any more time. (Also, I checked up there later, and there was nothing of interest.)
Hard demo count: 4
Wouldn't it just be silly if there wasn't enough time to clear the Credits level on Hard mode?

But, that wouldn't happen, right? I mean, if that were the case, the hack maker(s) would've caught that while testing the level and increased the time limit to compensate (or removed the time limit here altogether, because there's no real reason for the Credits level to have a time limit).
Alright, let's try this again...
Ooh, I think I got it! Yep, my horizontal speed is once again matching the auto-scroll speed. And now, ludicrous speed credits!
There we go. Now, gimme that P-switch! Also, get out of my way, Boo Block.
Wow, that's gotta be the most epic 50 I've ever gotten!
Dive bombin' the wall like a boss! Okay, now here, the Boo Ring being in the way isn't quite as bothersome, since I have way more time here than I did the first time.
Yes, I turned around when I needed to! I should be able to get back up!
Oh man oh man oh man! I'm still alive! I can totally come back from this!
Umm... I think I went too far... Shouldn't the screen have stopped scrolling by now?
Whew! Fortunately, the game didn't curse me with bad luck there!
BURN! BURN! BURN TO THE GROUND! TRI-FORMATION! BURN! WOO! BURN TO THE GROUND! WOO! BURN TO THE GROUND!
און איצט, שטוסיק גיכקייַט באָנוס שפּיל.
Monty Mole was here again.
I'm still going for all of the Yoshi coins, though, so I'll come back in bounds here.
That far. Can I get to the door from here?
Whoa. That could've been nasty.
That was close. But, I can slip by now.
Yeah, I figured I'd go for the slide-kill on that Boo Rock this time, even if it was a bit risky.
No, that's not quite it. I'm going very slightly slower than the auto-scroll speed here...
Hey, gimme that coin!
Wow, really? Yeah, I'd consider that a "possible fault within the credits"...
Okay, I got the 1-up. Good thing my cape makes the vine unimportant.
Alright, just one more...

Maybe if I didn't go left for those six coins early on, if I didn't waste time with the 1-up/feather/vine part, if I didn't get walled by those briefly ungrabbable ice blocks, and if that last Boo Ring wasn't in the worst spot, I could've made it.
...Or not. I blame the Eeries down there that must've appeared after I got the feather.
Yeah, I'm totally going to take advantage of any breaks I can this time around, mainly due to the time limit, which can be ridiculous.
Take FOUR!!! Let's speed up some of this footage now.
Now that I know these darker clouds are solid from the get-go, getting this Yoshi coin should be faster.
Huh. This time I effortlessly reveal that coin block.
That Eerie got uncomfortably close there, and this Boo Block is trying to block me from subscribing to it or commenting on its videos, but I'm not gonna let that stop me.
Wow, what is this? EVW? How far did I actually go?
Good-bye cruel world!
D'oh! I should've screened the scroll with "L" to despawn that guy there...
Hard demo count: 2
It looked like that shell landed on the hole for a split-second there. Moving holes are weird.
Up next is Spinies Disguised as Beetles Cave. Ah, but this time, I have offensive capabilities to use on them!
I'll switch to my flower, just to give it some use.

I'm not going to use my reserve power up right now, since I'm probably better off small if I'm not caped. Also, I notice that the Yoshi coins have reappeared, but I'm not gonna bother with them again. I already got them all once.

Uh, oh. This could be a problem. If I stay fiery, I could fry the beetle I'm trying to spin jump on. But, if I switch to the cape, I could end up cape-thwacking it before bouncing off of it... It's lose-lose either way if I get unlucky.
Goal tape average so far: Hard: 267 / 7 = 38.143 stars each. Overall: 690 / 18 = 38.333 stars each.

Okay, there's the goal, which isn't very friendly to those trying for a high star total. Is there enough room to take flight around here? Well, those spikes near the goal are kind of in the way, but what about further back?
Umm... You guys did test Hard mode and made sure there was enough time to finish the Credits level, right?
Alright, I'm feeling really good right now, so let's storm the Haunted Fortress!

Alright, I've finished that level, and just before the "Hurry Up!" warning, too. But, yeah, this level's lacking a Yoshi coin (unless I somehow missed it somewhere-- let me know if that's the case). UPDATE: Turns out I did overlook a Yoshi coin, which I got the first time in Normal mode. D'oh! I'll replay this level to get them all in another episode.
I don't know why I didn't just use "L" or "R" there, but there's the feather.
Finally, but that debacle ended up wasting some time, which I don't have much of left!

If anyone does know of some way I could possibly complete the Credits level there, let me know, but I seriously think it's impossible without using cheats or altering the hack from its current state. If there was at least a Yoshi anywhere, I could use the avoid time up death glitch, but I haven't seen any Yoshis in this hack at all.
Let's see if I can do that thing where I was flying with my horizontal speed matching the auto-scroll speed again, like last time.
YES!!! Wow, that was epic! And, I can now use this to my advantage, since there's plenty of room to take flight behind the goal. If I can manage to get 40 from here, that'll be fine.
Toasty!
I'm not letting myself slide out of control here this time!

Well, I hope you all enjoyed watching me play COLLAB! If an update that fixes the major flaws in this hack is made, let me know! Otherwise, I'm just gonna TAS this and then that'll be it for this hack!
Whoa, I wasn't expecting to go over the top there. Did the walls not stretch much farther than the top of the screen?
Bingo! But, the feather didn't spawn. However, if I just grab the 1-up and then do some screen scrolling, the feather should appear, right?
Bonus game average: Hard: 24 / 3 = 8 1-ups each. Overall: 53 / 7 = 7.571 1-ups each.
Nope. I couldn't pull off another epic miracle. I used up all of my epic miracle points at the end of the previous level.
Okay, the disco shell up there is operating properly this time, so I should be able to get that P-switch the intended way now, right?

And, unfortunately, since the Credits level scrolls at a set speed, has no midpoint (not that I'd expect a midpoint there), and there's no Yoshi to cheat death with, the Credits level is unwinnable on Hard mode.
Man, it's too bad there was no midpoint in this place. Some of the previous levels had midpoints, including the nasty Living Death Mine. So, why not here?
There's that suddenly-appearing koopa again. Okay, if I KO this guy and wait for his dead shell to leave the screen, and no Eeries suddenly spawn, the vine should be able to appear.
...Please?
Gah! I thought I could slip through there. This could get complicated...
Oh, what the heck? Come on, let me through! The dang sprite limit is preventing me from grabbing the ice blocks!
Okay, the goal can appear any time now!
Turbo button FTW! Wow, I'm amazed I didn't get hit there!
Whoa, that disco shell came down sooner than I was expecting! I managed to avoid dying horribly though.
50-star hits: 3 Goal tape average so far: Hard: 317 / 8 = 39.625 stars each. Overall: 740 / 19 = 38.947 stars each.
Well, all that's left is the Credits. I guess I'll play them one more time.

Alright, there'll be no interference from that guy this time! At least I should be able to save some time by not going for the Yoshi coins this time, and if I can avoid the other time-wasting things that happened, I should be fine as far as the time limit goes.
